title: SQL ServerCOALESCE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerCOALESCE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the first non-null value in a list:
SELECT 
  COALESCE(NULL, NULL, NULL, '.com', NULL, 'Example.com');

Definition and Usage
The COALESCE() function returns the first non-null value in a list.
Syntax
COALESCE(
val1
,
val2
,
....
,
val_n
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
val1, val2, val_n
Required. The values to test
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the first non-null value in a list:
SELECT 
  COALESCE(NULL, 1, 2, '.com');

❯
★
+1
